Posts.Content: Hi Slappy,I dont know what happened to my initial reply but Ill start again.I have yet to have sex since surgery,I still have to wait one more week according to my surgeon but three days after cath removal I had full hard erections daily with a little help.I have been taking viagra at bed time but dont know if this is still needed will see doc 8/30.Initially my penis was at least an inch shorter and not quite as thick but has since improved in both respects.Idont foresee any problems I would have with intercourse,six more days and counting the minutes!
Posts.Signature: july 2012 psa 6.0 at 45 years old April 2013 psa 6.3 at 46 years old biobsy 4/3/2013 4out 16 cores positive 3+4 30%,3+3 25%,3+3 15%,3+3 10% Davinci surgery at Lenox Hill Hospital N.Y.N.Y. with Dr.David Samadi,no better man have I met final pathology gleason 7 3+4,2 lymph nodes negative,extraprostatic and seminal vesicle invasion not identified 6%prostate involvement tumor size 1.3 cm,right and left posterior lobes pathologic stage pT2c,Pn0 31 grams 3.6x3.6x3.4 neg.margins cath removed 7/24 dribbles and squirts when bending for first 17 days 1.5 to 2.5 oz/day dry on monday aug 12 ,17 days later erection hard on third day after cath. removal, everyday since with a little help first psa five weeks post surgery undetectable

Posts.Title: ED drugs

Posts.Content: Mikla another thing to think about,if you are traveling for your surgery like I did, the american cancer society has hotels in major cities lik n.y wher you can stay for free.I stayed at one for thirteen days they have everything you need,kitchens wonderfull rooms and everyone there is going through something like you so there is no need to be self concious or uncomfortable about anything,just google Hope Lodge and the city name and you can find out if they have a facilety there.They really made life easy for us.

Posts.Title: Potential Surgeon List

Posts.Content: Hi Mikla,I had my surgery done by Dr. Samadi and he swears that he does all his surgeries from start to end and has a real problem with surgeons running multiple operating rooms.I met with two surgeons before him and instantly new I wanted him to do my surgery.His staff has been with him for years and they all treated me and my family like royalty,I had a private room at Lenox Hill Hospital and everyone on the floor were Dr.Samadis patients,after the surgery when I was walking the halls ,every hour or so after, the people I saw were all going through the same thing I was.There were four of us that had surgery that day and we all had our own nurse,I was never left wondering about anything.Do not hesitate to contact him,even after I was home I e-mailed him personally and he allways responded within an hour,and I sent mine at 5 am!I dont when he sleeps. Mike

Posts.Title: How long is surgery?

Posts.Content: I dont think you will be very happy with the decision to go home so quickly,Iwould agree that you will want to take a couple of days at least before that trip.Your stomach will feel as though you went a few rounds with Tyson, bouncing around in a car is not fun,I had a three mile cab ride in new york city that I didnt like very much.I stayed for ten days after surgery before my four hour ride home and that was great.Good luck with everything,Mike

Posts.Title: 8 hour ride home after di vinci?

Posts.Content: I did kegals regularly up to one hundred per day pre-surgery.When i got the catheter removed i was only leaking enough to use one pad per day,one per night though neither was full just changed for comfort,then I started to do kegals as per instructions from doctor, but must have been over doing them and exhausting the muscle as I started leaking more and actually filled a pad during the day,not much fun and kinda of depressing!I then bought a digital food scale and started weighing my pads keeping a log of kegals done and amount leaked,I scaled back on kegals to every other day for seven days and saw a steady .3 oz decline in wieght per day which was very encouraging!I stayed away from spicy foods alchohol and caffiene during the whole time drank water and bland food as to not irratate my bladder.After seven days,seventeen days after cath. removed I woke with a dry pad!!One of the first signs of improvement seemed to be the ability to squirt the last few drops at end of urinating,that happened after a few days of cutting back.I have one cup of coffe per day now and dont leak but have to go often for first few hours after, can even have a couple beers but have to pay attention when bending or stretching or I will have a little dribble.every one seems to have a different routine prescribed by their surgeon so I believe you have to expirement a little and see what works best for you.I was only leaking about 2.5 oz per day .4 over night at the height of flow but it was not comfortable.I also walked 2 miles first thing in the morning.I hope this helps and encourages you when it finally ends you will barely remember how bad it was.Good luck mike
Posts.Signature: july 2012 psa 6.0 at 45 years old April 2013 psa 6.3 at 46 years old biobsy 4/3/2013 4out 16 cores positive 3+4 30%,3+3 25%,3+3 15%,3+3 10% Davinci surgery at Lenox Hill Hospital N.Y.N.Y. with Dr.David Samadi,no better man have I met final pathology gleason 7 3+4,2 lymph nodes negative,extraprostatic and seminal vesicle invasion not identified 6%prostate involvement tumor size 1.3 cm,right and left posterior lobes pathologic stage pT2c,Pn0 31 grams 3.6x3.6x3.4 neg.margins cath removed 7/24 dribbles and squirts when bending for first 17 days 1.5 to 2.5 oz/day dry on monday aug 12 ,17 days later erection hard on third day after cath. removal, everyday since with a little help first psa five weeks post surgery undetectable

Posts.Title: Dad's PSA is still 0!!!

Posts.Content: Hi,Bob I returned to work after 6 or 7 weeks,I work in construction,eight hour days with a one hour commute and for the first 4 or 5 weeks by one in the afternoon I was toast and when I got home I showered and went to bed around 7 or 8 pm.I dont think you are experiencing anything different than I did.My surgery was in july 2013 and I think I felt normal somewhere around the beginning of november.Just my 2 cents worth.

Posts.Title: Post Op recovery, what is the real time

Posts.Content: Bob I forgot to say the first sign I remember before improvement was that when it felt like I was done urinating that I could squirt a little extra out,that felt so good it was like having a little control,like I could almost empty my bladder and have a few minutes of relief!
Posts.Signature: july 2012 psa 6.0 at 45 years old April 2013 psa 6.3 at 46 years old biobsy 4/3/2013 4out 16 cores positive 3+4 30%,3+3 25%,3+3 15%,3+3 10% Davinci surgery at Lenox Hill Hospital N.Y.N.Y. with Dr.David Samadi,no better man have I met final pathology gleason 7 3+4,2 lymph nodes negative,extraprostatic and seminal vesicle invasion not identified 6%prostate involvement tumor size 1.3 cm,right and left posterior lobes pathologic stage pT2c,Pn0 31 grams 3.6x3.6x3.4 neg.margins cath removed 7/24 dribbles and squirts when bending for first 17 days 1.5 to 2.5 oz/day dry on monday aug 12 ,17 days later erection hard on third day after cath. removal, everyday since with a little help first psa five weeks post surgery undetectable
Posts.Title: Do kegels after surgery increase the likelyhood of leakage

Posts.Content: I too experienced increased leakage from doing kegals but I think I may have been overdoing them ,I cut back a little and did them with less intensity and saw improvement.I have noticed that most people on this forum recieved differing advice from surgeons on the amount of kegals to be done and all of us have had different results.I kept a log of the weight of my pads and the number of kegals to see what worked best for me,also the things you eat and drink can make a dramatic difference alchohol,caffiene and for some reason brown gravy had me leaking like a fire hose,learn what affects you and avoid until you regain control,hang in there and things should improve. mike

Posts.Title: Do kegels after surgery increase the likelyhood of leakage

Posts.Content: While it may sound like a dream run from my signature after returning to work,I work in construction,things weren't as lovely.Having to do physical labor continence was a constant battle I spent half the day swearing and then when people asked what was wrong I eventually quit saying "nothing"and just said "I peed my pants"and they stopped asking,it actually was a little comical until you leave work and want to cry!Also after the beginning of September I would squirt or leak urine when I began to get an erection, which has improved and I find if I lay on my back it doesn't seem to be an issue.I realize from reading on this forum that I am quite fortunate in many regards but I sure do miss being normal.I limit everything I drink, caffiene and alchohol to very small amounts and followed everything my surgeon told me to do,I did nothing but walk around for six weeks and it seems to have paid off.Every one seems to recover at different rates and i wish you the best. Mike
Posts.Signature: july 2012 psa 6.0 at 45 years old April 2013 psa 6.3 at 46 years old biobsy 4/3/2013 4out 16 cores positive 3+4 30%,3+3 25%,3+3 15%,3+3 10% Davinci surgery at Lenox Hill Hospital N.Y.N.Y. with Dr.David Samadi,no better man have I met final pathology gleason 7 3+4,2 lymph nodes negative,extraprostatic and seminal vesicle invasion not identified 6%prostate involvement tumor size 1.3 cm,right and left posterior lobes pathologic stage pT2c,Pn0 31 grams 3.6x3.6x3.4 neg.margins cath removed 7/24 dribbles and squirts when bending for first 17 days 1.5 to 2.5 oz/day dry on monday aug 12 ,17 days later erection hard on third day after cath. removal, everyday since with a little help first psa five weeks post surgery undetectable

Posts.Title: Do kegels after surgery increase the likelyhood of leakage

Posts.Content: Bob I forgot to say the first sign I remember before improvement was that when it felt like I was done urinating that I could squirt a little extra out,that felt so good it was like having a little control,like I could almost empty my bladder and have a few minutes of relief!
Posts.Signature: july 2012 psa 6.0 at 45 years old April 2013 psa 6.3 at 46 years old biobsy 4/3/2013 4out 16 cores positive 3+4 30%,3+3 25%,3+3 15%,3+3 10% Davinci surgery at Lenox Hill Hospital N.Y.N.Y. with Dr.David Samadi,no better man have I met final pathology gleason 7 3+4,2 lymph nodes negative,extraprostatic and seminal vesicle invasion not identified 6%prostate involvement tumor size 1.3 cm,right and left posterior lobes pathologic stage pT2c,Pn0 31 grams 3.6x3.6x3.4 neg.margins cath removed 7/24 dribbles and squirts when bending for first 17 days 1.5 to 2.5 oz/day dry on monday aug 12 ,17 days later erection hard on third day after cath. removal, everyday since with a little help first psa five weeks post surgery undetectable
Posts.Title: Do kegels after surgery increase the likelyhood of leakage

Posts.Content: I too experienced increased leakage from doing kegals but I think I may have been overdoing them ,I cut back a little and did them with less intensity and saw improvement.I have noticed that most people on this forum recieved differing advice from surgeons on the amount of kegals to be done and all of us have had different results.I kept a log of the weight of my pads and the number of kegals to see what worked best for me,also the things you eat and drink can make a dramatic difference alchohol,caffiene and for some reason brown gravy had me leaking like a fire hose,learn what affects you and avoid until you regain control,hang in there and things should improve. mike

Posts.Title: Do kegels after surgery increase the likelyhood of leakage

Posts.Content: I had my surgery on july 17,2013 by Dr. Samadi.His office staff as well as surgical staff were awesome,they made my family and my self feel so comfortable and at ease that i dont remember even being nervous about the procedure at all.I regained continence(no more than an occasional drip)seventeen days after cath. removal,and erections easily with viagra,about 75% without pills.I returned to work in construction 6 weeks after surgery and that was the continence test,while home doing normal household chores I had no problems,at work it was more of a challenge while bending down repeatedly lifting heavey items and walking over rough terrain I leaked small squirts and drips.Its been seven weeks since return to work and continence at work is real good almost dont think about it.My erections had a strange turn, in the beginning I had no problems other than needing stimulation to maintain then I began leaking urine when I started to become erect,that was depressing,but that has just about resolved itself.My first psa was undetectable at five weeks and am coming up on my next test.During this entire time when ever I had a question or concern I would email Dr Samadi often at 4 or 5 am before I left for work and he usually responded within twenty minutes or I would call his office and talk to his nurses Helen or Izzy who are so helpfull and reassuring ,I may have been a pain in the ass at times with Qs but they never showed that I was.I wouldnt hesitate to contact him if I were you.For whatever reasons people may think that Dr. Samadi is self promoting I dont care, he is all that he says and he backs that up with his actions.Big EGO?Maybe ,but he took great care of me and my family and never seemed aloof or egotistic very humble in fact with great pride in his team!
Posts.Signature: july 2012 psa 6.0 at 45 years old April 2013 psa 6.3 at 46 years old biobsy 4/3/2013 4out 16 cores positive 3+4 30%,3+3 25%,3+3 15%,3+3 10% Davinci surgery at Lenox Hill Hospital N.Y.N.Y. with Dr.David Samadi,no better man have I met final pathology gleason 7 3+4,2 lymph nodes negative,extraprostatic and seminal vesicle invasion not identified 6%prostate involvement tumor size 1.3 cm,right and left posterior lobes pathologic stage pT2c,Pn0 31 grams 3.6x3.6x3.4 neg.margins cath removed 7/24 dribbles and squirts when bending for first 17 days 1.5 to 2.5 oz/day dry on monday aug 12 ,17 days later erection hard on third day after cath. removal, everyday since with a little help first psa five weeks post surgery undetectable
Posts.Title: Question about Robotic Prostatectomy Techniques

Posts.Content: The doctors i spoke of are from Miriam hospital.I met with radiation oncologist today he like my urologist agree i should have it removed,meeting with Dr David Samadi Mt.Sinai hospital in N.Y on saturday about robotic ,seems to be the best option,just have to chose the surgeon and Dr.Samadi seems to be one of the best hopefully!!
Posts.Title: treatment in rhode island

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies,I am 46 and the cancer was staged tc1.My psa last year was 6 then 3 months ago it was 6.3 before that i am not sure switched doctors last year new doc was concerned then i went to 2 uroligists both wanted to do biopsies and here i am again thank you

Posts.Title: Question about Robotic Prostatectomy Techniques

Posts.Content: I was recently diagnosed with prostate cancer psa 6.3 cancer in 4 out of 11 cores on one side 3+3.I am leaning towards removal as best option for cure.The doctors I have been dealing with are Dr.Harry Ionatti and Dr.Gyan Pareek Ihave met with Ionatti have an appointment with Pareek have also set up a phone consult with Dr Samaddi in N.Y I was wondering if anyone has had surgery with any of these Docs or of a place to find this info.It has only been two weeks since diagnoses so i feel i have time to look around and make an informed decison on best doc for surgery,any info would be welcome,thank you
Posts.Title: treatment in rhode island

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies,I am 46 and the cancer was staged tc1.My psa last year was 6 then 3 months ago it was 6.3 before that i am not sure switched doctors last year new doc was concerned then i went to 2 uroligists both wanted to do biopsies and here i am again thank you
Posts.Title: treatment in rhode island

Posts.Content: The doctors i spoke of are from Miriam hospital.I met with radiation oncologist today he like my urologist agree i should have it removed,meeting with Dr David Samadi Mt.Sinai hospital in N.Y on saturday about robotic ,seems to be the best option,just have to chose the surgeon and Dr.Samadi seems to be one of the best hopefully!!
Posts.Title: treatment in rhode island

Posts.Content: I was recently diagnosed with prostate cancer psa 6.3 cancer in 4 out of 11 cores on one side 3+3.I am leaning towards removal as best option for cure.The doctors I have been dealing with are Dr.Harry Ionatti and Dr.Gyan Pareek Ihave met with Ionatti have an appointment with Pareek have also set up a phone consult with Dr Samaddi in N.Y I was wondering if anyone has had surgery with any of these Docs or of a place to find this info.It has only been two weeks since diagnoses so i feel i have time to look around and make an informed decison on best doc for surgery,any info would be welcome,thank you
Posts.Title: treatment in rhode island

Posts.Content: Hi delawerean,I would seriously consider getting a room in new york for a couple of days!!I had my surgery on july 18th in new york Istayed for thirteen days after the surgery at the Hope Lodge wich is run by the american cancer society fo free,and i gotta tell you after the cab ride from the hospital three and a half miles to the lodge I cant even imagine a few hours on the train.My stomach muscles were useless for a few days after surgery and the tenderness felt when sitting down wasnt great either,do yourself a favor and look into staying for as long as you can.Who are you having the surgery with?Mine was done by Dr.David Samadi and Icouldnt be happier with my results!Best of luck to you
Posts.Title: Travel

Posts.Content: Hi Fran,Im 46.The first week was probably the worst as far as continence,I was walking 3 to 5 miles per day in new york city about the fourth day after cath removal but still didnt fill one pad per day.After ten days amount was decreasing by .3 ounces per day + or - and today i woke with totally dry pad.I walked 2 miles and the pad weighed the same at the end of the walk as when i started,the only time I wore a pad today!! Hope it stays like this.Still a little sore when sitting very minor, abdominals starting to feel normal a little discomfort down low but feeling good,I slept in a zero gravity chair my brother sent me while in N.Y there was no way I could lay down in the bed or get out of the bed if I had to.Why did you have catheter in for twelve days?Any special reason or is that what your doc does?
